channel.title: JavaScript Weekly
channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: „ÄêBreaking a promise„ÄëËøùËÉåÊâøËØ∫
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã695 ‚Äî July 4, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

How to Annul Promises in JavaScript ‚Äî You can 'cancel' XHR and fetch requests, but can you cancel regular promises? Currently, no, but Zachary looks into doing the next best thing: telling a promise the game's up, and discarding/ignoring its eventual¬†results.

Zachary Lee

regex 2.1: Turn JavaScript's Regular Expression Support Up to Eleven ‚Äî From the co-author of O‚ÄôReilly‚Äôs High Performance JavaScript and Regular Expressions Cookbook comes an enhancement for JavaScript‚Äôs regex support. Supporting all of ES2024‚Äôs regex functionality, it adds support for free spacing and comments, atomic groups, regex subroutines, context-aware interpolation of RegExp instances, and¬†more.

Steven Levithan

üí° The author also tells us a Babel plugin for regex is expected to be released later¬†today.

‚úÇÔ∏è Cut Your QA Cycles Down to Minutes with Automated Testing ‚Äî Are slow test cycles bottlenecking your dev teams' release velocity? With QA Wolf , your organization can run entire test suites in minutes, not days. Plus, get to 80% automated E2E coverage in just 4 months (zero flakes, guaranteed). Schedule a¬†demo.

QA Wolf sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • Nicholas C. Zakas writes about different JavaScript runtimes and how you can preserve the ability to switch runtimes easily.

  • The React Native team says developers building modern React Native apps should be using a framework to do so, such as Expo.

  • Web pioneer Marc Andreessen tells ‚ñ∂Ô∏è the origin story of Mosaic and¬†Netscape.

  • ü§¶ If you can't get your Lighthouse scores to 100%, you could always pretend.. A trick to keep an eye out¬†for..

  • There are at least 535 ways to reload a page with JavaScript.

RELEASES:

  • Backbone.js 1.6 ‚Äì The classic library gets a little¬†update.

  • Qwik 1.6 ‚Äì Qwik 2 is coming soon, though.

  • A raft of Node.js Security Releases are due on July 8.

  • ESLint 9.6, PrimeVue 4.0, Bun 1.1.18

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Enhancing The New York Times' Web Performance with React 18 ‚Äî Last year, The New York Times set out to take full advantage of React 18 on its flagship news site. This is a tour of the challenges faced in upgrading, coupled with the significant benefits they managed to take advantage¬†of.

Ilya Gurevich (NYT)

How to Use a Go(lang) Library from JavaScript with WebAssembly ‚Äî Compiling Go code to WebAssembly opens up some interesting opportunities in the¬†browser.

Thomas Derflinger

Inside Look: How Sentry Debugs with Sentry ‚Äî Join Sentry engineer Yagiz Nizipli to learn how he optimizes tasks with Sentry, saving $160K/yr. RSVP for tips¬†&¬†tricks!

Sentry sponsor

How We Tamed Node.js Event Loop Lag ‚Äî Node famously uses very few threads yet can handle a large number of clients performantly, as long as the work associated with each client is ‚Äòsmall.‚Äô When that work isn't 'small', as here, things can go off the rails¬†quickly.

Eric Allam

How People with Disabilities Use the Web ‚Äî Describes tools and approaches that disabled people use to interact with the Web and the barriers these people face. Of interest are the user personas that show the range of specific people‚Äôs¬†experiences.

W3C

A Set of Modern Web Performance Guides ‚Äî A helpful collection of guides, covering things such as working with the different core web vitals, JavaScript optimization, metrics, and¬†more.

SpeedCurve

üìÑ Why Google Sheets Ported Its Calculation Worker from JS to WasmGC Thomas and Steiner (Google)

üìÑ Working with Pasted Content in JavaScript Raymond Camden

üìÑ How to Parse HTML Programatically in JavaScript Brian Wachira

üìÑ TypeScript 5.5: A Blockbuster Release Dan Vanderkam

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

BWIP-JS: A Barcode Writer in Pure JavaScript ‚Äî A library that can generate barcodes using over 100 different barcode types and standards, both single and two dimensional. There is, of course, a live demo where you, too, can discover far more types of barcodes exist than you ever¬†imagined.

Mark Warren

Superstruct 2.0: Define Interfaces to Validate Data at Runtime ‚Äî Designed for validating data at runtime with an annotation API inspired by TypeScript, Flow, Go and GraphQL. GitHub¬†repo.

Ian Storm Taylor

Software Consultants Your Team Actually Wants to Work with ü•≥ ‚Äî Test Double solves tough problems from strategy to execution. Weekly rates. Open contracts. No management¬†required.

Test Double sponsor

Termino.js 2.0: Create Terminal-Like Experiences in the Browser ‚Äî No dependencies, customizable, and you can create multiple terminal instances on a single page. Demos.

Marketing Pipeline

Fabric.js 6.0: A SVG-to-Canvas and Canvas-to-SVG Library ‚Äî Provides an interactive object model on top of the HTML5 canvas to make it easier to work with multiple visual elements¬†there. The homepage is a complete live¬†demo.

Fabric.js

Flitter: A Flutter-Like JavaScript Data Visualization Framework ‚Äî Boasts a declarative syntax and support for both SVG and Canvas to allow you to build high-performance data visualizations, interactive charts, diagrams, and more. It‚Äôs also easy to integrates with React, Svelte, etc.

Flitter

SquirrellyJS 9: A Powerful Template Engine ‚Äî A modern, configurable, and fast template engine promising ‚Äúthe power of Nunjucks‚Äù and ‚Äúthe simplicity of EJS‚Äù. There‚Äôs an online playground if you want to see it in action. GitHub¬†repo.

Ben Gubler

  • Hexo 7.3 ‚Äì Popular Node.js blog framework / generator.

  • gridstack.js 10.3 ‚Äì Build responsive interactive dashboards¬†quickly.

  • React-PDF 9.1 ‚Äì React component to display¬†PDFs.

  • MUI X 7.8 ‚Äì Popular React component¬†suite.

üéÅ¬†And one for fun

Sliderland: A Minimalist Coding Playground ‚Äî A slider control based visualization you can code with simple formulas. We last linked to this a few years ago, but it‚Äôs still a fun way to do some quick, visual JS math experimentation. Tixy.land is along similar lines, but based on a 2D¬†grid.

blinry

blinry

item.title: „ÄêThe results are in„ÄëÁªìÊûúÂú®
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã693 ‚Äî June 20, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Results of the State of JavaScript 2023 Survey ‚Äî It feels odd including something about 2023 in June 2024, but the results of the major annual JavaScript developer survey are now out. It‚Äôs interesting to see what features JS devs do and don‚Äôt use, changes in library popularity over time, what build tools people are using, the divide between JavaScript and TypeScript usage, and much more¬†besides.

Devographics

How JavaScript is Finally Improving the Module Experience ‚Äî Multiple long-term proposals collectively known as ‚Äúmodule harmony‚Äù will complete the features lost as developers move away from¬†CommonJS.

Mary Branscombe / The New Stack

Simplify Your Data Collection with a Fully Integrated Form Management Platform ‚Äî SurveyJS is an open-source JavaScript library suite for secure form creation and data collection in your app. Build JSON-driven surveys/forms quickly, without manual coding. Integrate with any backend system, gather and store responses while retaining full control over your¬†data.

SurveyJS sponsor

How React 19 (Almost) Made the Internet Slower ‚Äî Even changes that are planned in advance can have big effects on the developer experience if people aren‚Äôt aware of them. A change to Suspense in React 19 led to much confusion and surprise, but the story has a happy ending with the React team ready to listen to end users more¬†closely.

Henrique Yuji

IN BRIEF:

  • Evan You, the creator of Vue.js, recently gave ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†a talk on 10 years of Vue, covering both its past and¬†future.

  • Over on Twitter/X, Daniel Lemire showed off a situation where Bun is much faster than Node.js, even when both are using the same underlying library, due to the complexities the V8 engine¬†introduces.

  • üéµ Did you know TC39 now has its own pop group and a¬†song?

RELEASES:

  • htmx 2.0 ‚Äì The popular 'access lots of JS and Web API features via special HTML attributes' library gets a new major version mainly to remove deprecations and drop IE¬†support.

  • Electron 31 ‚Äì The cross-platform desktop app framework steps up to Chromium 126, Node 20.14, and V8¬†12.6.

  • Relay 17 ‚Äì Facebook's declaritive GraphQL client for¬†React.

  • ESLint 9.5, Serverless Framework v4, pnpm 9.4

Your Fastest Path to Production ‚Äî Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease ‚Äì from your first user to your¬†billionth.

Render sponsor

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

‚ñ∂¬†¬†3D in TypeScript with Raycasting ‚Äî Raycasting is a somewhat old fashioned technique to render 3D environments (you may have seen it in 1992‚Äôs Wolfenstein 3D) but it‚Äôs easy to understand and worth implementing at least¬†once.

Tsoding Daily

Live Types in a TypeScript Monorepo ‚Äî Several strategies to make a TypeScript monorepo feel more ‚Äúalive‚Äù in the sense of the propagation of¬†changes.

Colin McDonnell

Intro to Sentry & Codecov: Live Demo ‚Äî From pre to post-release, learn how Sentry help developers find and fix errors and slowdowns and deploy with¬†confidence.

Sentry sponsor

What Happens When a Major npm Library Goes Commercial? ‚Äî The ua-parser-js library is commonly used to parse user agent strings and gets over 12 million downloads a month, but it has recently switched to AGPL+commercial¬†licensing.

Matteo Collina

Dual Publishing ESM and CJS Modules with tsup and 'Are the Types¬†Wrong' ‚Äî tsup makes it easy to bundle TypeScript libraries and 'Are the Types Wrong?' analyzes packages for issues with their¬†types.

John Reilly

üìÑ How to Use Google Sheets as a 'Database' from React Paul Scanlon

üì∫ How Svelte and RSCs are Changing Web Development ‚Äì A group discussion including Svelte‚Äôs Rich Harris, Tracy Lee, Ben Lesh, and Adam¬†Rackis. This Dot Media

üìÑ Mastering Date Formatting using Intl.DateTimeFormat Rafael Camargo

üìÑ MobX Memoizes Components (You Don't Need React Compiler) ‚Äì If you‚Äôre actually using MobX, that¬†is. Mike Johnson

üìÑ Refactoring a Scroll-Driven Animation from JavaScript to CSS Andrico Karoulla

üìÑ UUIDv7 Implemented in 20 Languages ‚Äì Surprisingly short and¬†sweet. Anton Zhiyanov

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Phoenix: A macOS Window Manager You Can Script with JS ‚Äî macOS is set to adding more window management features in Sequoia, but how about something you can script entirely with JavaScript right now? GitHub¬†repo.

Kasper Hirvikoski

JSONEditor: A Component for Viewing and Editing JSON ‚Äî If your app needs to let users work with JSON directly, this is worth a look. It supports both text and tree views and is cross browser compatible. Live¬†demo.

Jos de Jong

Transformational Auth & Identity | Userfront ‚Äî "Compared to our previous experiences in the security/auth space, Userfront is an order of magnitude simpler to¬†use."

Userfront sponsor

Rooster v9.6: Microsoft's Framework-Independent Rich Text Editor ‚Äî A rich-text editor control neatly nested inside a single div element (demo). Several years old, but still¬†maintained.

Microsoft

NLUX: A Library for Rendering Conversational AI Experiences ‚Äî If you want to spin up a ChatGPT-style conversational experience on top of your own services or third party AI backends, this provides the pieces needed to get an interface up quickly. GitHub¬†repo.

Salmen Hichri

‚öôÔ∏é NodeSwift ‚Äì Bridges Node.js and Swift so you can write Swift code that talks to Node and vice¬†versa. Kabir Oberai

‚öôÔ∏é Vuesion ‚Äì Boilerplate for Next/Vue app¬†development. Werner-Most Ideen GmbH

‚öôÔ∏é Kitbag Router ‚Äì Type safe router for¬†Vue.js. Craig Harshbarger

QUICK RELEASES:

  • Electron Store 10.0 ‚Äì Simple data persistence for Electron¬†apps.

  • React Date Picker 7.1 ‚Äì Simple date picker component.¬†(Demo.)

  • Monads 0.7 ‚Äì Rust-inspired Option, Result, and Either types.

  • Plasmo 0.88 ‚Äì "Like Next.js for browser¬†extensions."

  • MUI X 7.7 ‚Äì Popular React component¬†suite.

  • React Tag Autocomplete 7.3

ü§ñ QUICK NOTE

Next week, I'm attending the AI Engineer World's Fair. If you happen to be there, come and say hi!

It might be a bit late to attend in person unless you're based in SF, but you can subscribe to the AI Engineer YouTube channel to be notified when the livestreams go live next Wednesday and Thursday if you'd like to see what's going¬†on.

‚Äî Peter Cooper, your editor

„Äë

#‚Äã693 ‚Äî June 20, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Results of the State of JavaScript 2023 Survey ‚Äî It feels odd including something about 2023 in June 2024, but the results of the major annual JavaScript developer survey are now out. Integrate with any backend system, gather and store responses while retaining full control over your¬†data.

SurveyJS sponsor

A change to Suspense in React 19 led to much confusion and surprise, but the story has a happy ending with the React team ready to listen to end users more¬†closely.

Tsoding Daily

Live Types in a TypeScript Monorepo ‚Äî Several strategies to make a TypeScript monorepo feel more ‚Äúalive‚Äù in the sense of the propagation of¬†changes.

Colin McDonnell

Intro to Sentry & Codecov: Live Demo ‚Äî From pre to post-release, learn how Sentry help developers find and fix errors and slowdowns and deploy with¬†confidence.

Sentry sponsor

Matteo Collina

Dual Publishing ESM and CJS Modules with tsup and 'Are the Types¬†Wrong' ‚Äî tsup makes it easy to bundle TypeScript libraries and 'Are the Types Wrong?' analyzes packages for issues with their¬†types.

John Reilly

üìÑ How to Use Google Sheets as a 'Database' from React Paul Scanlon

üì∫ How Svelte and RSCs are Changing Web Development ‚Äì A group discussion including Svelte‚Äôs Rich Harris, Tracy Lee, Ben Lesh, and Adam¬†Rackis. This Dot Media

üìÑ Refactoring a Scroll-Driven Animation from JavaScript to CSS Andrico Karoulla

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

  • React Date Picker 7.1 ‚Äì Simple date picker component.¬†(Demo.)

item.title: „ÄêThe biggest TypeScript release in years?„ÄëÂ§öÂπ¥Êù•ÊúÄÂ§ßÁöÑ TypeScript ÁâàÊú¨Ôºü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã692 ‚Äî June 13, 2024

Read on the Web

üìù I've recently encountered readers who've been surprised to learn this isn't our only JavaScript newsletter. We have Node Weekly and React Status too ‚Äì check them out if you're a Node.js or React developer, as we focus more closely on them there!¬†:-)
__
Your editor, Peter Cooper

JavaScript Weekly

TC39 Meets Again and Advances Key Proposals ‚Äî The Ecma TC39 group that pushes forward the development of ECMA/JavaScript met again this week and moved several key proposals forward, including Deferred Import Evaluation, Error.isError(), RegExp escaping, and Promise.try.

Sarah Gooding (Socket)

Announcing TypeScript 5.5 RC ‚Äî This is shaping up to be one of TypeScript‚Äôs more significant releases, with popular dev-YouTuber Theo ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†dropping a 30 minute video on what he‚Äôs calling ‚Äúthe biggest TypeScript release in¬†years.‚Äù

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

WorkOS: Enterprise-Grade Auth You Can Implement in¬†Minutes ‚Äî Like an enterprise plan in a box: WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, Audit Logs, User Management, and RBAC. It's used by some of the hottest startups including Perplexity, Vercel, & Webflow. Future-proof your auth stack with¬†WorkOS.

WorkOS sponsor

How to Compose JS Functions That Take Multiple Parameters ‚Äî ‚ÄúFunction composition is beautiful,‚Äù says James, who goes on to explain, in his usually elegant way, the use of partial application, currying, composite data structures, and¬†more.

James Sinclair

IN BRIEF:

  • An industry survey has found while Rust's popularity is growing rapidly, but 'JavaScript continues to take the top spot for programming¬†languages'.

  • The stabilization process of Deno's Standard Library has begun.

  • üáÆüá™ NodeConf EU is back, taking place in Ireland this November.

RELEASES:

  • Nuxt 3.12 ‚Äì The Vue.js meta framework.

  • Bun 1.1.13 ‚Äì The one that isn't Node or¬†Deno.

  • Node.js v22.3.0 (Current), Ember 5.9, Inertia 1.2, Astro 4.10

State of Frontend 2024 Survey Is Out Now! Hundreds Have Already¬†Joined ‚Äî Spare a few minutes to fill in the survey and receive a free report on the future of frontend¬†development.

The Software House sponsor

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

'I Tried React Compiler Today, and Guess What..' ‚Äî The recently unveiled React Compiler automatically memoizes things ‚Äì so can we ditch memo, useMemo and useCallback right away? Nadia investigates, finds the rough edges, and helps keep our feet on the¬†ground.

Nadia Makarevich

'How a Single Vulnerability Can Bring Down the JS Ecosystem' ‚Äî A slightly alarmist headline and it‚Äôs more about npm, but the issue outlined could have nonetheless posed big problems ‚Äì luckily, GitHub is on the¬†case.

Roni Carta (Lupin)

Your Fastest Path to Production ‚Äî Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease ‚Äì from your first user to your¬†billionth.

Render sponsor

Generating ZIP Files with JavaScript ‚Äî JSZip makes it easy to dynamically create an archive for users to¬†download.

Josh Martin

Using Node.js's Test Runner: The Official Guide ‚Äî A new guide on the official Node site covering the fundamentals of using Node‚Äôs new test runner functionality, along with snapshot tests (supported by Node¬†22.3).

Jacob Smith

üìÑ Using the Page Visibility API ‚Äì Set up event listeners to do things when page visiblity¬†changes. Brian Smith

üìÑ Getting Started with Directus and Preact ‚Äì Directus is a headless CMS built on top of Node and¬†Vue. Jay Bharadia

üìÑ Powering Angular with Rust via WebAssembly ‚Äì How you could start using Rust in your Angular¬†app. Evgeniy Oz

üìÑ Angular Directives vs. Vue Directives Christian Nwamba

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

DGM.js: Infinite Canvas Library with Smart Shapes ‚Äî A library for rendering and working with infinitely pannable canvases that contain ‚Äòsmart shapes‚Äô that you can script and give various constraints and properties. GPLv3¬†licensed.

Minkyu Lee

Pastel 3.0: A Framework for Building Ink Apps ‚Äî Ink brings the power of JSX and React components to building command line apps. Pastel provides more structure on top of that in a Next.js¬†fashion.

Vadim Demedes

Add Authorization, MFA, Biometrics and More to Your JavaScript App in Just Minutes ‚Äî It's about time that somebody talked some sense about OAuth and JavaScript. So we did. You're¬†welcome.

FusionAuth sponsor

uuid v10: Generate RFC-Compliant UUIDs ‚Äî Covers all major UUID standards. Works across all major browsers and Node 18+. v10.0 adds support for more types of RFC9562¬†UUIDs (namely v6, v7 and v8).

Robert Kieffer and contributors

JsonTree.js: Customizable Tree Views for JSON Data ‚Äî No dependencies, lots of customizations, and it‚Äôs easy to theme the trees using CSS variables. Try out some examples on the docs¬†site.

William Troup

Turf.js 7.0: Geospatial Engine for Browsers and Node ‚Äî A collection of modules for doing spatial analysis, working with GeoJSON data, data classification, and more. GitHub¬†repo.

Morgan Herlocker

Parvus 2.6: Accessible Lightbox with No Dependencies ‚Äî I love how it says not to use overlays on web pages but if you have to, use this! There‚Äôs a CodePen¬†example.

Benjamin de Oostfrees

DON'T OVERLOOK THESE:

‚öôÔ∏é Dukpy ‚Äì A simple JavaScript interpreter for¬†Python. Alessandro Molina

‚öôÔ∏é ngx-sonner ‚Äì An opinionated toast notifications component for Angular, inspired by the React¬†equivalent. Clara Castillo

‚öôÔ∏é River.ts ‚Äì A composable, type-safe Server-Sent Events (SSE) interface. Matthias Tellen

‚öôÔ∏é JSVectorMap ‚Äì Render interactive maps for visualizations. Mustafa Omar

QUICK RELEASES:

  • Lambda API 1.1 ‚Äì Zero dependency web framework for serverless JS¬†apps.

  • TS-Pattern 5.2 ‚Äì Pattern matching library with smart type¬†inference.

  • üóìÔ∏è React Big Calendar 1.13 ‚Äì GCal/Outlook-like calendar¬†component.

  • YouTube.js 10.0 ‚Äì An unofficial way to use YouTube's internal¬†API.

  • Starry Night 3.4 ‚Äì High quality GitHub-like syntax¬†highlighting.

  • BlockNote 0.14 ‚Äì 'Notion-style' block-based¬†editor.

  • Marked 13 ‚Äì Fast Markdown compiler¬†/¬†parser.

üéÅ¬†And One for Fun

Bread Jam: Make Variables and Properties Easier to See in VS Code ‚Äî An interesting new VS Code extension that offers 11 different ways to make variable names stand out more in your editor, with both basic colorization approaches and an interesting emoji-based prefix¬†option.

Ting Wei Jing

„Äë

#‚Äã692 ‚Äî June 13, 2024

Read on the Web

üìù I've recently encountered readers who've been surprised to learn this isn't our only JavaScript newsletter. We have Node Weekly and React Status too ‚Äì check them out if you're a Node.js or React developer, as we focus more closely on them there!¬†:-)
__
Your editor, Peter Cooper

JavaScript Weekly

TC39 Meets Again and Advances Key Proposals ‚Äî The Ecma TC39 group that pushes forward the development of ECMA/JavaScript met again this week and moved several key proposals forward, including Deferred Import Evaluation, Error.isError(), RegExp escaping, and Promise.try.

Sarah Gooding (Socket)

Announcing TypeScript 5.5 RC ‚Äî This is shaping up to be one of TypeScript‚Äôs more significant releases, with popular dev-YouTuber Theo ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†dropping a 30 minute video on what he‚Äôs calling ‚Äúthe biggest TypeScript release in¬†years.‚Äù

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

WorkOS: Enterprise-Grade Auth You Can Implement in¬†Minutes ‚Äî Like an enterprise plan in a box: WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, Audit Logs, User Management, and RBAC. It's used by some of the hottest startups including Perplexity, Vercel, & Webflow. Future-proof your auth stack with¬†WorkOS.

WorkOS sponsor

How to Compose JS Functions That Take Multiple Parameters ‚Äî ‚ÄúFunction composition is beautiful,‚Äù says James, who goes on to explain, in his usually elegant way, the use of partial application, currying, composite data structures, and¬†more.

James Sinclair

IN BRIEF:

  • An industry survey has found while Rust's popularity is growing rapidly, but 'JavaScript continues to take the top spot for programming¬†languages'.

  • The stabilization process of Deno's Standard Library has begun.

  • üáÆüá™ NodeConf EU is back, taking place in Ireland this November.

RELEASES:

  • Nuxt 3.12 ‚Äì The Vue.js meta framework.

  • Bun 1.1.13 ‚Äì The one that isn't Node or¬†Deno.

  • Node.js v22.3.0 (Current), Ember 5.9, Inertia 1.2, Astro 4.10

State of Frontend 2024 Survey Is Out Now! Hundreds Have Already¬†Joined ‚Äî Spare a few minutes to fill in the survey and receive a free report on the future of frontend¬†development.

The Software House sponsor

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

item.title: „ÄêSay hi to ECMAScript 2024„ÄëÂêë ECMAScript 2024 Êâì‰∏™ÊãõÂëº
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã694 ‚Äî June 27, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Look at JavaScript's New Set Methods ‚Äî Finding the intersection, union, and difference between sets, among other set-related tasks, is now a piece of¬†cake. Available in Node 22+, Chrome/Edge 122+, Firefox 127+, Safari 17+, and now considered a 'baseline' feature.

Brian Smith (MDN)

Ecma International Approves ECMAScript 2024: What‚Äôs New? ‚Äî This week, the Ecma General Assembly approved the latest ECMAScript / JavaScript language spec, officially making it a standard. As with ECMAScript 2023, it‚Äôs a small step forward, but Dr. Axel looks at what‚Äôs¬†new.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Create Consistent UIs with Storybook ‚Äî Join Steve Kinney for this extensive video course on building scalable, reusable component libraries and design systems with Storybook. Covers set up, styling, documentation, testing,¬†and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.5 ‚Äî One of the most significant TypeScript releases in terms of features in a long time. There‚Äôs support for the new Set methods (mentioned above), regex syntax checking, isolated declarations, inferred type predicates, and more. A bumper packed release¬†post.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • üìä Socket's Sarah Gooding has put together a good, easily-skimmed roundup of the State of JS 2023 survey results.

  • üßä Someone's created an ASCII 3D renderer in JavaScript. Why? Why not! There's a live demo here.

RELEASES:

  • Playwright 1.45.0 ‚Äì Microsoft's browser/Web automation library now has a clock API for manipulating time within tests to verify time-related¬†behavior.

  • Bun v1.1.16 ‚Äì The fast JavaScript runtime and¬†toolkit.

  • Astro 4.11, Electron 31.1, PouchDB 9.0, Node.js v20.15.0 (LTS)

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

üëë¬†Recreating the Queens Game in Vue ‚Äî Queens is a puzzle game that combines elements of Minesweeper, chess, and¬†Sudoku.

Fotis Adamakis

Understanding React Compiler ‚Äî The new, experimental tool from the React team automates your performance tuning by rewriting your code ‚Äî¬†but should you use it, and how does it work under the hood? Tony takes a¬†look.

Tony Alicea

Local-First Development Will Be Unlocked by Sync Engines ‚Äî Sync engines are behind the amazing UX of apps like Linear and Figma. PowerSync is a plug-in sync engine for web¬†apps.

PowerSync sponsor

Uniting Web and Native Apps with 4 Lesser-Known JavaScript APIs ‚Äî Looks at some 'under-the-radar' web features, such as the Screen Orientation API and Contact Picker API, and how they can be used to create user friendly¬†PWAs.

Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez

Exploring Randomness in JavaScript ‚Äî Specifically, Math.random() versus Crypto.getRandomValues().

Ben Nadel

Drawing the Auth Owl at Userfront | Transformational Auth & Identity ‚Äî Read the story behind Userfront. Including the vision behind the company and what auth should (and shouldn't)¬†have.

Userfront sponsor

üìÑ Slack's AI-Powered Conversion from Enzyme to React Testing Library ‚Äì If the robots are taking jobs, at least they're the jobs that we often don't want to do.. Sergii Gorbachov (Slack)

üìÑ How to Mock a Child Component When Writing Angular Tests Casey Falkowski

üìÑ Morphing Arbitrary Paths in SVG Alexandru-Gabriel IcƒÉ

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Node-RED 4.0 Released ‚Äî Node-RED is a popular ‚Äòlow code‚Äô event-driven app development environment that uses Node.js behind the scenes. v4.0 requires Node 18 or up, improves its ‚Äòmultiplayer‚Äô support (when multiple users are working on the same system), faster deploys, and other all-round¬†improvements.

OpenJS Foundation

React-Admin v5 ‚Äî A MIT-licensed framework for building React apps on top of REST or GraphQL APIs. You get some added structure and numerous building blocks out of the box. GitHub¬†repo.

Fran√ßois Zaninotto

Deploy Your SSR Apps on AWS, Fast ‚Äî Deploy any frontend framework quickly with AWS Amplify hosting. Scale to millions? ‚úÖ Branch deployment? ‚úÖ PR previews?¬†‚úÖ

AWS Amplify sponsor

wavesurfer.js: Audio Waveform Player Library ‚Äî Get responsive and customizable waveforms that provide a visual impression of audio. There are plugins for working with timelines, recording, rendering spectrograms, and more. Many examples¬†here.

katspaugh

PixelMatch 6.0: A Fast Pixel-Level Image Comparison Library ‚Äî Give it two images, it‚Äôll highlight the differences. Now distributed as a ES¬†module.

Mapbox

üìÑ¬†PDFSlick: View and Interact with PDFs ‚Äî An interesting PDF viewer for React, Solid, Svelte and other JavaScript apps. Built on top of PDF.js, it uses Zustand to provide a reactive store for loaded documents. Live¬†demos.

Vancho Stojkov

  • Ky 1.4 ‚Äì Simple HTTP client based upon Fetch for browsers, Node¬†&¬†Deno.

  • React Awesome Query Builder 6.6 ‚Äì Logical query builder control.¬†(Demo.)

  • Matter.js 0.20 ‚Äì A 2D rigid body physics engine.

  • ka-table 11.0 ‚Äì Lightweight React table component.¬†(Demos.)

  • OverlayScrollbars 2.9 ‚Äì JS custom scrollbar¬†plugin.

  • Wouter 3.3 ‚Äì Minimalist router for React &¬†Preact.

„Äë

#‚Äã694 ‚Äî June 27, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Look at JavaScript's New Set Methods ‚Äî Finding the intersection, union, and difference between sets, among other set-related tasks, is now a piece of¬†cake. Available in Node 22+, Chrome/Edge 122+, Firefox 127+, Safari 17+, and now considered a 'baseline' feature.

Brian Smith (MDN)

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Frontend Masters sponsor

  • Astro 4.11, Electron 31.1, PouchDB 9.0, Node.js v20.15.0 (LTS)

PowerSync sponsor

Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez

Ben Nadel

Userfront sponsor

üìÑ Slack's AI-Powered Conversion from Enzyme to React Testing Library ‚Äì If the robots are taking jobs, at least they're the jobs that we often don't want to do.. Sergii Gorbachov (Slack)

üìÑ How to Mock a Child Component When Writing Angular Tests Casey Falkowski

üìÑ Morphing Arbitrary Paths in SVG Alexandru-Gabriel IcƒÉ

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Node-RED 4.0 Released ‚Äî Node-RED is a popular ‚Äòlow code‚Äô event-driven app development environment that uses Node.js behind the scenes. v4.0 requires Node 18 or up, improves its ‚Äòmultiplayer‚Äô support (when multiple users are working on the same system), faster deploys, and other all-round¬†improvements.

OpenJS Foundation

React-Admin v5 ‚Äî A MIT-licensed framework for building React apps on top of REST or GraphQL APIs. You get some added structure and numerous building blocks out of the box. GitHub¬†repo.

Fran√ßois Zaninotto

Deploy Your SSR Apps on AWS, Fast ‚Äî Deploy any frontend framework quickly with AWS Amplify hosting. Scale to millions? ‚úÖ Branch deployment? ‚úÖ PR previews?¬†‚úÖ

AWS Amplify sponsor

PixelMatch 6.0: A Fast Pixel-Level Image Comparison Library ‚Äî Give it two images, it‚Äôll highlight the differences. Now distributed as a ES¬†module.

üìÑ¬†PDFSlick: View and Interact with PDFs ‚Äî An interesting PDF viewer for React, Solid, Svelte and other JavaScript apps. Built on top of PDF.js, it uses Zustand to provide a reactive store for loaded documents. Live¬†demos.

Vancho Stojkov

  • React Awesome Query Builder 6.6 ‚Äì Logical query builder control.¬†(Demo.)

  • Matter.js 0.20 ‚Äì A 2D rigid body physics engine.

  • ka-table 11.0 ‚Äì Lightweight React table component.¬†(Demos.)

  • OverlayScrollbars 2.9 ‚Äì JS custom scrollbar¬†plugin.

  • Wouter 3.3 ‚Äì Minimalist router for React &¬†Preact.
